messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (10:28): hmm. All the broken xrefs seem to be those with <dfn><code>foo</code></dfn>
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (10:33): shouldn't those really have been <code><dfn>foo</dfn></code>?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:39): Hixie: should id="" be checked for uniqueness?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:39): Hixie: <foo id=""><bar id=""> should that only whine about empty string ids or also about duplicate ids?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:44): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Duplicate IDs are now checked. Thanks.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:45): in other news, Validator.nu now checks meta refresh values
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:45): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: cool, glad you added it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:50): Philip`: I rephrased the non-streamability message as you requested
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:03): http://developers.facebook.com/fbopen/

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:04): Has anyone ever checked how AT sees <figure><legend>? Apparently screenreaders have some special behaviour for <legend> that might prevent graceful degradation
ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2 (11:09): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, do you check uniqueness of, and existence of the elements for, for= values?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:11): for= also needs to do type checking
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:11): ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2: I think I do (for HTML5--not HTML4)
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (11:11): http://svn.facebook.com/svnroot/platform/fbopen/lib/fbml/fbjs.php is the real meat as far as I can tell there
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:11): <label for=x>...</label> <input type=hidden id=x> should not be conforming
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:12): <label for=x>...</label> <div id=x></div> should not be conforming
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:12): etc.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:12): ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2: yeah, I check for it
ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2 (11:12): cool
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:13): the XHTML 1.0 / HTML 4 support in V.nu really sucks compared to the (X)HTML5 support
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:13): I wonder if I should just remove XHTML 1.0 / HTML 4 support or keep fixing the breakage
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:13): or leave it in a sucking state
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:14): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, it doesn't catch the type=hidden above
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:14): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, it does catch the <div> element
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:14): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: good catch.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:15): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: is referring to type=hidden forbidden in the spec? (it probably should be)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:15): might not be forbidden just yet
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:16): in fact, I don't think WF2 makes additional requirements about for
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:19): a more complicated check might be not allowing referencing a <datalist> child unless the <label> is itself a child of the same <datalist>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:19): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I found another type=hidden bug while I was at it. thanks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:19): has totally forgotten about datalist
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:20): why would labels refer to datalists?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:20): <label for=x> ... </label> <datalist> <select id=x> </select> </datalist>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:21): the conforming case would be <datalist> <label for=x> </label> <select id=x> </select> </datalist>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:21): it seems kind of nasty to check
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:22): consider http://bugzilla.validator.nu/show_bug.cgi?id=232 postponed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:22): (deploying the easier fix now...)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:22): yeah, fair enough
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:23): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, any progress on your Forms TF stuff?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:23): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, the Forms WG people have stopped radio silence, maybe we should say something back
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:24): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: yeah, we should
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:24): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I think I can get something written in the next few days
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:24): though if I don't get it done before next week, then I'll be out of action for a bit due to WWDC
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:25): better get on it then ;)
